evidence: Repository structure shows multiple numbered directories with single Python files, indicating standalone scripts or examples
No packages or modules are defined, suggesting a flat structure
Each directory appears to contain isolated examples or exercises rather than components of a larger system
Files are named similarly across directories (e.g., dropdown.py, app.py), suggesting reusable snippets or templates rather than organized modules
Average fan-out is low (2.33), consistent with simple, independent scripts
Maximum directory depth is only 2, which aligns with a simple example-based layout
risks: Lack of clear module or package structure may lead to code duplication
Low fan-out suggests limited interaction between components, which may not scale for larger applications
Directory naming convention implies tutorial-style organization, not production architecture
